intro: Oreocarya macbridei, commonly known as the MacBride's oreocarya, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central Mexico. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations, showcasing adaptations to harsh, arid environments. Its foliage is often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss and protect against intense sunlight. Oreocarya macbridei is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
